questions.q: Correlation does not imply causation. Why?
questions.a: Two things can be related without one causing the other

questions.q: If A causes B and B causes C, does A cause C?
What is a confounding variable?
questions.a: A variable that influences both cause and effect, creating spurious correlation

If you roll two dice, what is the probability of getting a sum of 7?
What is Bayes' theorem used for?
questions.a: Updating probabilities based on new evidence

questions.a: Use a circle (or square for polygons)

questions.q: What is the traveling salesman problem?
questions.a: Finding the shortest route visiting all cities exactly once

questions.q: What is gradient descent?
questions.a: An optimization algorithm that iteratively moves toward a minimum

questions.q: What is the difference between local and global optimum?
questions.a: Local is best in neighborhood, global is best overall

questions.q: What is an algorithm?
questions.a: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem

questions.q: What is the difference between O(n) and O(n^2) complexity?
questions.a: O(n) is linear, O(n^2) is quadratic - much slower for large n

questions.q: What is recursion?
questions.a: A function that calls itself to solve smaller instances of the same problem

questions.q: What is the halting problem?
questions.a: The problem of determining whether a program will finish running or run forever

questions.q: What is dynamic programming?
questions.a: An optimization technique that stores solutions to subproblems to avoid recomputation
